author: Hi -Zere
text:
Do you want to Safe? Yes [x] / No [  ]


Saving.......


Progress has been safed! 


Checkpoint: Here i am...after losing my job, right after getting my education done, 3 Years wasted for an Job that isnt required to function in the situation we are living in right now. So i was unemployed, worring i wont finding anything and landing on the street, losing more than i have gained, being in the negativ in the  Bank, almost lost all hope, but the tiny light inside just yelled from the corner it lifes in my mind, "keep going" "keep looking" "all hope is only lost, when you are dead" "dont give up, before you even tried anything", so i started to look for new options and luck was on my side. A friend of mine has a mother that is working in a place that needed workers, so i just applied, just becase i toght why not....after 3 months of uncertanty and also different trys on other jobs, i get a call, asking if i had some spare time. It was my future boss asking if i can come for an Job interview, of corse i accepted! In just 2 Hours after the call i had my Contract in my hands and didnt know how happy someone can be to have a job agian^^´ Evrything happend so fast...now im working already for 3 Months agian, got out of the Minus in the bank and dont have to worry for now were to go or landing on the street. All that shit happend in just a span of half a year, so many thing will and can happen all the time, so we have to use that time to the maximum, i dont want to waste anymore of my time waiting to hope it will get better, I am the change that needs to happen and if i want the change i can make it happen! There is always an option, not always its a good one or a good idea to go after a certian way, but even then i can always decide that is not the way anymore, just in an blink of an eye all things can change!...

author: イナバ
text:
@犬走椛  たしか、古代文明で女王に苗木を燃やせと言われた女性の選択肢で『こっそり植える』を選択する。
中世でフィオナの小屋付近に穴が出来るのでそこのボスを倒す。(ボスに水・氷属性の術技を使って防御ダウン？させて目玉を叩く)
フィオナと会話後にロボが離脱。
シルバードで現代へ行くと森が復活しフィオナの小屋があった所にフィオナ神殿が建っている。
奥に置かれているロボに話しかけると上記の台詞になり、ルッカの過去イベントが開始される。
ロボに話しかける前にセーブしておいた方が良いかも？

たしか、こんな感じ。間違ってるかも？

author: 犬走椛

author: MM HH
text:
小学生の私がこの曲に初めて出会った時の心に沁み込む切ない感情は、20年以上経った今でも変わりません。

例えば私が好きなScarborough Fair、Green sleevesも同じく、子供ながらに”私はこの曲を知っている”と感じた曲です。

世界中の人が共通して感じることの出来るこの切なさは、先祖から代々受け継がれて来た私達自身も気が付かない記憶の繋がり、地球が生まれた時から、私達が元は一つだったという事を、思い出す事が出来る力があります。

私は自分の事を純日本人だと思っていますが、Scarborough FairとGreen sleevesが英国の民謡であることを踏まえると、先祖の中にイギリス人が居るのかもしれません。

今は遺伝子検査で自分のルーツが分かるみたいなので、調べてみたいですね。

author: Cadistra
text:
Checkpoint; 12/22/2020
----------------------------------------
I'm tired. I'm coming to the realization that I work in a job, live in a house and live in a country where I can work my fingers to the bone, and they're happy to receive/profit off my hard work, but when I reach out for compensation, recognition, or help, I'm ignored or tossed by the wayside. Sometimes I wonder what's the point of trying, but I realize I am in a better situation than many others, so I shouldn't say anything. 
I wish all of you the best, and figure that it's okay to stop for a spell.  Time will keep marching on, and so will we all. ♥

author: Atlas
text:
This music is so good, it hits a special place in my heart. The moment it started I was hit with that nostalgic  d o p a m i n e.  Emotions, sensations, and the being of who we are is carried in the memories and their life given by music. Never forget what you once loved, for there is a part of you that still does. You may never be able to forget and play it all again for the first time, but you can play it a hundredth and recall why the first was so special.

  Never stop loving what defined your joy, and let your joy define you.

author: DragonRider
text:
Checkpoint: life is really hard right now... I'm constantly fatigued, stressed, overwhelmed, depressed, or some combination. I'm going through some rough patches with my family right now, and there's a possibility my sister might go into the hospital sometime soon because she has really bad anorexia. I'm being put in the middle trying to protect my sister from my overly worried parents, hearing her side of the story and believing in her, wanting to help, understanding my parents worry but trying to calm them down, trying so hard to appease everyone; even though I know there's no way to do that... 

And I'm dealing with my own shit, school is really stressful, keeping a functional social live is hard, trying maintain and balance my own mental/physical health on top of the mounds of work I have to do that never seems to end, and it doesn't help that the world is so negative at the moment. It's so hard... So so hard...

I've suffered through severe depression for over 6 years now, I've been in and out of hospitals for various reasons, I've had long periods of time where it is extremely hard to get out of bed. But... despite all that I have come a long way. I have new coping skills, really supportive friends, and a lot of wonderful things to live for. This year especially has been extremely difficult, but I have kept pushing through, and I will continue to do so. Even though it may be really dark right now... I know I can always find that small sliver of light to guide me on. Keep believing in life and yourselves, everyone. Look for the small things that make you feel good and cherish them. And know that it is okay to cry and be sad, and sometimes the hard and scary emotions can help you feel better on the other side. Good luck!

Saving... Game saved 11/11/20

author: DragonRider
text:
Hey MotoMario, I know it might be hard to understand, but a lot of people use songs like this to feel better, and share their experiences. A lot of people call them "checkpoints" so they can "save" what has happened to them. A lot of these checkpoints are for people who have gone through rough patches, but are promising to continue on. They can be really hopeful to other people reading the comments by sharing good things that others have just gone through, or talking about something that someone has just overcome. I can understand if that seems weird to you, that's valid. But to some, it's a helpful way to get through life. 
I'm sorry for the long comment, just wanted to give you some clarification. Have a good day/night!

author: lotustyle
text:
I didn't play this game for the first time until 7th grade, and I didn't even finish it at the time. I finally beat the DS port when I was around 19-20(?) Its weird though, fast forward a decade; I'm now 29. However, this song and the entire soundtrack transport me back to a time before all of these decisions and responsibilities. Innocence, I think that's what you call it. Since then, I've made so many mistakes and hurt so many people. It's ironic that a game about time travel could invoke feelings about going back and fixing my mistakes. 

Anyways, I just hope I can play a remake of this game in this lifetime, and if anyone sees this, thank you for reading. I appreciate it.

text:
Ah. I love Chrono Trigger. Brings back a lot of memories of playing it on a DS simulators. An Amazing RPG that everyone should try. 

Well, I dunno how many checkpoints I've done, but here we go.

I'm quite conflicted about everything really. Should I go for money or passion? I really dunno honestly. I need money to solve any external problems that I might face. But I just love Music. But I know it won't make enough money. I really don't know what to do really. I just hope, I dont regret whatever decision I'll make. I want to go with the flow, but that may lead me to my downfall. It might be hard to get back up again. I jut hope I'll come to my senses soon.

author: Just Call Me Kai
text:
I played this game back in early 2016 (I was about 13-14 at the time) however I didnt have an actual Snes or Ds instead used a DS emulator. I actually heard of CT already and heard many good things about it. At first I didn't believe the praises thr game got. "It looks a bit mediocre and kinda lame" were my words at the time. But I had to play it for myself and.. I will never forget it. Seriously at the end of the game, it had me shed a tear which doesnt happen that often from me. The jouney was phenomenal.

The thing that pulled me in the most was the music. The music was soo good it got stuck in my head for actual months. I would hum Schala's Theme while drawing or doing work for school. It also helped and is still helping me get through depression  which happens very often even when im around others. Listening to the ost can lift my spirits up in those moments so I can stay focused on a task at hand. I know I was a bit rambly but hey just wanted to share a little thought^^. If anyone comes here I just wanted to say somebody somewhere appreciates you❤

Checkpoint: August 18, 2020  6:26 pm Central Time

author: ThePsyShyster
text:
First checkpoint, I guess. Weird that it took me nearly 20 years...
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Life's been hard. I lack motivation and drive, and I'm too scared to take those first steps I know need to be taken. All my life I've known to not take risks. If I take a risk, I'll just get in trouble. So I don't risks. But life its about the choices we make; considering if its worth taking a risk for the potential result.

Today is the start of my second year of college. I'm trying to get my psychology degree. I want to be a counselor. I was lucky to have two fantastic counselors when my decrepit life was being torn even more asunder 3 years ago. I want to be there to help those who were as pained as I was back then. But, even if things go as well as possible, I won't be done with my degree and attending for over half a decade. I just want to help, but I doubt I can help anyone as I am now. I can't even help myself.

I've been dabbling in writing for the past 4 years. I mostly have been bouncing between poetry, a novel idea, and some scripts for YouTube videos. However, it always feels like I run out of steam just a couple of days after starting up on a project. I feel lost and helpless and I can't even convey it in text as I once could. And as passionate as I am of some of the scripts I've written, covering unique topics of video game localizations and language studies, I fear my own person is far too bland to actually get people's attention. I'll just be shouting into stagnant air, no winds to carry them off to intrigued ears. I waste enough time. I'd rather not sink so much time and effort into something no one cares for when I could waste as much time with anything else and little-to-no effort.

Hopefully soon, I'll be able to clear my head. I know I have a mountain ahead of me that needs to be conquered. I just hope I have what it takes.

author: ReZaHydra
text: I’ve never played Chrono-Trigger. As a JRPG enthusiast who sees Final Fantasy 6 and Bravely Default as the pinnacles of the genre yet still nowhere close to perfect, I need to. I have no excuses, no reason, and know very little besides some of the music, the fact you can fight the final boss anytime, and that the game involves time travel. As I mentioned, it’s a crime I haven’t played this game, and I hope to play it one day. Perhaps on an actual cartridge found cheap, maybe on emulator, or even possibly a dream port that isn’t instantly garnered as bad.

author: Albert Sáez Núñez
text:
Checkpoint:

This is my first checkpoint of all, as of today, the day I've discovered this magnific world/community of loner people or maybe not loner but just with a head full of ideas and expressions to get out, I am 20, in my 3rd year of a degree in Network Engineering, working with my mum on a traditional market.

I love what I do, what I learn, it is my passion. I just could not imagine me doing anything else. It's not that I'm a genius, not a mastermind of engineering, but nevertheless I think that I have a bit of a touch in the area, I know how to play the cards and when to play them. But since the last year I'm not at my full.

Last summer I did some sort of an internship at an important organitzation of Europe (pure luck and people network but still I was there and I learned a lot) and I got full of hope, then I came back to home... And I got to do another internship in a startup which turned to be a bad idea, I had no experience, no knowledge on the topic, the people in there didn't help me as much as they said they would and all of the sudden, the anxiety and depression I had came back, hitting harder than ever. Got my girlfriend really worried, distancied myself from my friends so much I lost that contact with my best bud.

The year begun, I was destroyed, could think that much or that fast, got slower, got dubious again, still I managed to do ok, I was one of the five people who only passed without failing anything, but there is something in my head, something is squizing it, it feels inflamated...

Since then I haven't got any better, in fact everything is more complicated, mum has been diagnosed with depression, my grandma with Alzheimer and my grandfather with cancer, dad's work is about to enter bankruptcy, my sister has moved, but has no money and I have my suspicion on her boyfriend hitting her some times, can't prove it though. Everything is crumbling down as I just can only watch and feel pain.

I wake up every morning feeling remorse, rage and irritated, I help my mum in the market and then go home to do nothing. I have some projects started but I don't feel like doing so.

To finish with something good, I still have hope and dreams of working in things like The Ocean Clean Up or projects that help people or the ecosystem, I don't care if I'm a janitor in the center, because I'll be cleaning the stuff for the people that help to clean the world. I just want to help people.

August 4th, 2020. 23:22.
Save file? Y/N



Y

author: Matheus Lenke
text:
Hello traveler

i'm in my 3rd year of computer Science, and i'm sorry for everything it's happening in your life right now, i now a little how hard it can be. But i hope things are getting better for you! We are all fighting a lot, i like to remind sometimes that i'm not alone in all my problems and that even if life isn't the best for us now, we can always make it better for the future generations, and that's my fuel everyday. So i hope you can find happiness in your journey, and don't underestimate medical help, it sure help us a lot to move through this hard levels of life too.

author: Eelektross Succ
text:
So this is the "Edge of the Internet" that MidnightMumbles spoke of.
(Shoutouts to the guy since his channel has 1.9k views thanks to the SM64 Iceburg that's big right now. He did a video about this video, so go say hi!)

Enough about that, i'll add to the Wall of Memories for you kind folks.

Chrono Trigger wasn't my first JRPG. That was FF4 Advance, which i stole off a cousin since i got addicted to it and being young.

I never finished it since i got stuck in the Giant of Babel, unable to beat the Boss Rush and running out of items so i could grind.
I also couldnt restart the game since 9 year old me didn't know what "parry" meant.

I got caught months later and sent it back to him, apologizing.

However, despite stealing from them, he sent me the DS Version of Chrono Trigger since I liked the genre.

Chrono Trigger was the First Game I ever beat. It took me an entire 6 months to do it because of the whole "Run 3 times coumterclockwise around the room" puzzle by Spekkio. I got it one day with luck, and kept going estatically, and I think it was worth the wait. 

Eventually I got the Main Ending and got Super Hype, then did a New Game+ realizing there was more than 1 ending.

The only other Ending I got was the "Beyond Time" Bomus ending exclusive to the DS version... and to this day the Dreamseeker (The Dreamstone Sword you get for doing the ending.) has held a Special Place in my Heart as a Iconic JRPG weapon.

It took me a few months to beat the Reptite Sanctuary, and I always got too unlucky to get the Ending for Speedkilling Lavos the game with Chrono/Lucca at the beginning.
One fay I lost the Catridge during a car ride, only to find it years later in an unusable state... but regardless of that, my memories of the game are still strong.

Said Cousin who gave me the Game passed away in April this year of Covid-19, still in his mid 20's... and him being the person who gave me my first console (a Silver GBA) is responsible for me even being into Video Games and some of my Personality/Knowledge today.

It's 1:47 am EST at the time of writing and it's a calm night despite the chaos in America... All of you please take care, be safe, and have a good night. I'll wander around the checkpoints to share my stories.

author: William Schmidt
text:
I've got this recommended with the "corridors of time" video about a week ago, after that i've found the "Stickerbush Symphony" video and got to the comment section, as usual. When i read all these coments about failures, sadness, inspirational and joyful checkpoints... i was astonished. How can this virtual place, became the safe place for so many people? How all these songs, that are intrinsic linked with our childhood, bring together all our thoughts and most deep insights to words? Thrilled by all those people, i started wondering and came here (again), because CT is my favorite game since i've played it.
Then i realized, in that scene on the camping, after Robo's being repared by Lucca, after restoring the Fiona forest, they talk about the "entity" that is linking all those different eras, to combat lavos. Who's opening that portals, to all those points on earth's history, where's history has shifted? Destiny? God? The Earth itself? So, i've got this parallel, this place is similar to the CT history. The "entity" bring us here, and here we are.

Checkpoint?

I hit the last checkpoint not that long ago, so I imagine this was recommended to me because I watched that video. I think checkpoints should be evenly spaced out, though, so I'll have to cut my ties with these videos until I find them naturally again.

As for my life? Well, nothing too crazy is going on. I guess I'm a little stressed out about doing school work and such, but it's not that much of a worry for me. Honestly, I feel more like a side character in someone else's story than a main character in my own. But I'm happy to be that, for the moment. I just have to keep hoping that I'll have a story of my own to tell some day.

author: Eelektross Succ
text:
Far from the Last Checkpoint, friend.

Shit's gone down, especially here in the US... with 2020 looking like it's the end.

And yet, there is still hope out there, blowing on the wind.
Even if things go to hell, people will come and fix the mess that was made, even if it takes lifetimes to do it.

This checkpoint is simply here to remind you things are still young, and even when they do die, the winds of change will come and start something else anew. Hopefully something brilliant.

author: Aaron Bell
text:
Checkpoint:
Was suicidal. Then I got the idea to set a new goal: to please myself. I'm constantly finding ways to make myself happier. It's making others around me happier, too. I have more money than I ever had, 100% free time b/c the coronavirus got me out of the job (but w/ more money than I made there!), I have nicer relationships, I've run 32 miles in the past 36 hours, I've finished an Experimental Design textbook, I built my first Ruby on Rails app, I coded another app in JavaScript. I have two potential clients, and I might be moving to a place where the rent is half as much, doubling my financial security. Some day, death may find me, but I think I'll leave in a happier way than I initially planned.
Cheers to you and your life. May you please yourself, too!
June 13th, 2020

author: William Walworth
text:
June 15, 2020
Checkpoint 5

This is the 5th checkpoint i have come across so far. It amazes me how some simple soundtracks have brought so many people together, almost in a surreal way that is enchanting to an extent. 

Life is strange, i’ve had my fair share of ups and downs. I’m still trying to get myself figured out, trying to discover my passions and things to work towards, and have just small glimpses of those things and people so far. I guess the further i travel the more my story will grow and my character develop, and one day i wish to rest knowing that i impacted this dark, hurting world for the better.

Would you like to save? 
>Yes
   No

author: Hoax Memoir
text:
First Checkpoint ever. Cleverly enough, this player didn't saved before. She probably likes some kind of danger, and certainly nostalgia. Loses everything or dies trying. Maybe she's trying to clean her slate at this point. But the game seems quite endearing and beautiful. She hates endings somehow. I hope that feeling keeps going trough time. She hates journeys, She needs a reminder that she's missing all the fun.

Game Saved: 12/06/ 2020
00:34 AM.

author: Ike
text:
When times are tough, and it's all crashing down.
Know that music is here to help turn it around.
A bit of beats, a bit of synth,
To fight injustice, bring truth to myth.
But be wary friend, the world is dark.
Take a good, calm rest, before you embark.
You may not know me, for it is true.
Just know that somehow, someone out there
Loves you.

author: ViolentHour
text:
Six or Seven Years ago I've downloaded an emulator on my old PC and played Chrono Trigger for the first time. I was too young to play it or even read the dialogue in it when it came out. I was already pretty lonely by then, having changed schools on the last two years of High School. On my former school, I was able to befriend at least two people, one of them who is still my best friend. The other adored this song and adored chrono trigger.

I remember vividly watching him play it on the keyboard I had at home and feeling jealous of how well he did. Well, he was well built, dated one of the hottest chicks in the grade, according to many of our peers and was, by far, the best MK player I went against, obliterating me with the same skills you'd only see Hbox perform with on Melee, that's the best way I could describe it.

It's been half a year since the group separated. It came one day, when we had classes until the end of the day and I was set on getting a passing grade by then. I got a call from a mutual saying this friend wanted to meet me. It clutches my chest to admit it, but I felt lazy and thought I could hang out with him every day I could... But that day I was alone.

Next day was a Friday, I've spent the night thinking I wanted to call him and the rest of the gang to hang out at  our usual place. It would be fine, since it was the weekend. I went to class like always until I got a message asking me to check Facebook. I saw a bunch of RIP and other sorts of messages all around my friend's page. I thought it was trolling, my group played pranks on each other a lot, except... It wasn't. He had hung himself the same night I was thinking on how to make up to missing our hangout.

I didn't go to the funeral, I wasn't sure how I would react, but while it went on, I cried for two hours on the couch, I lost all energy I could by crying on the couch. I couldn't forgive myself. Later the same month I found out he took steroids and dealt with intense depression. The only one blind from the darkness in him was me and me alone.

As the years passed, the pain subsided. I still missed him and thought about him from time to time. It was a lot of pain, I still feel it clutching my heart. But I had forgotten most details... I searched around because I had the urge to listen to Stickbush Symphony on youtube, the song seemed to calm me much and I found this channel. I began checking the videos posted and this was amongst the last few.

You can imagine how all my memories came flooding back, it's bittersweet really, because at first I felt like choking up, but as I keeping hearing, and I keep writing this, all I can think of are the happy memories now...

Artur is gone. Gone by a demon that hid inside you for so long. A darkness that took you away from all of us. I can't bring you back, I know it, and it sucks... But I think now I hear this song and thank god I have met you, dude. Be it heaven or whatever fucking place you ended up on... Just fucking know you mattered so much to everyone. And if I find you on the day I go, then, please... Please let's just hang out like I couldn't do it on the day you died.

author: Daniel Bueno
text: Thank you for keeping things real. Reading a "I love you" from a stranger on the internet makes me think people are stupid if they think I'm going to believe someone I've never met in my life loves me. That's not how love works, and I'm glad it isn't. Reading a "someone out there loves you", however, is truly comforting, and that came at a great time to me. Thank you for that.

author: ファラシー
text:
つい先日クロノトリガーをクリアした。
実はニコニコ流星群でこの曲が入っていたのでこの曲だけは知っていた。だが、あくまでも組曲の中の1曲といったイメージで、大した感情は持っていなかった。実際にプレイし、中世のフィールドでこの曲が流れた時、本当に涙がこぼれた。本当に何故かは分からないけど、懐かしさを感じたのだと思う。
主人公たちの時間軸は現代だが、タイムリープで中世に来る度に帰ってきたような気分になった。
この曲とカエルのテーマは名曲揃いのクロノトリガーの中でも特に名曲だと思う。これからもクロノトリガーをプレイしてこの曲を知ってくれるプレイヤーが増えてくれれば良いな。

text:
この曲初めて聞いたけど
なんでもっと早く聞いてなかったんだろ、って思っちゃう。むっちゃいい曲。

宣伝見たいになっちゃうけど、ドラクエの「決戦の時」も個人的には神曲だと思ってる、是非聞いて欲しい、ていうか聞いてくれ。
こういう落ち着いた音楽が好きな人にはあんまり合わないかもだけど。
あ、そうだ、YouTubeで調べたらゲーム音源版とコンサート版が出てくると思うんだけど、ゲーム音源版の方がおすすめ！

Nah, ya got me all wrong.

“Can you not admit [to crying?]”

Almost 4 months ago, my baby boy was born. The first says where a lot of hardships, didnt had any money, no job, barely making it every day. The first month the baby couldnt sleep at all, and I usted to put this video and another few ones as background noise and were able to put him at ease and calm him down. Now, hes about to be 4 months old, I got a good paid job, bought a car, doing a whole por great and came back and started to read the comments and got chills from the wholesomeness given by everyone.

*And I will place this comment on all the vídeos I played for him to make him sleep

author: Liike Pipes
text: Still remember when I got this, I was in 4th of 5th grade and it was my birthday, I had no clue what this game was but I got it from my grandma for my birthday. At that time I had no true interest in the game, but I gave it a try and it was something else... To be honest listening to the soundtrack warms my heart and fills me with happiness but also saddness of the fact I can never go back to experience the game the same way. I had a friend named Jeremiah he played this game too and we nicknamed eachother as the characters, he was Frog and I was Crono. He left in 5th grade to a different school, since then Ive never talked to him. My parents have been divorced since I was a toddler and when I went to see my dad he’d guide me through the game. Now here I am about to graduate highschool... Life flies by... Too fast, sadly....

author: Acesecus_HipHop
text: Damn Man .... Shit, that last part really hits the feels man ...I have never heard of or even played Chrono Time..i stumbled onto this video randomly lol....(such a beautiful soundtrack)...I'm about to graduate High school too, last few months before graduation...Life really does flies by fast depending on perspective on different points of our lives but ironically at the same time.. we as Humans want some parts to go by fast depending bad experiences and shit...but we cannot escape our past..and we must accept who we are and know we all can become a better person and it is never too late to make a great grand change in this world Aye! But also... We must also Learn from whatever happen in the past, to make sure we rise above it and Keep On Pushing Forward... so we can make great use of this time for the future, so life and time doesn't seem wasted when it flash-forwards many years into the future...... Thank you for your comment and input Liike Pipes, you helped reinforced the fact alongside this beautiful music that...."You don't have to be Great to Start something, but You do have to Start to be Great at that Something..whether it be Music, A Passion, Art, etc."

author: vuuvovuuv
text:
this game was made by
the creator of dragon ball (akira toriyama)
the creator of final fantasy (hironobu sakaguchi)
the creator of dragon quest (yuji horii)
not to mention the musical pedigree and masterful storytelling of people like nobuo uematsu, yasunori mitsuda, masato kato, and so on


these names may or may not carry a lot of weight to you, but all of these people were doing their own genius things on their own, and somehow all came together to make this brilliant, perfect piece of gaming. the more i play this game and the more i find out about who made it, the more i realize it's truly a once-in-a-lifetime piece of artwork

author: Marllon Bruno

I couldn't understand all the things, but I really appreciated the game, even without understand English. Today I'm so thankful to know that game for that long time and I play it every single year. I love the history and I love the game mechanics and I love the way it made me like RPG's in general. I'm 20 today and I think people of all ages can appreciate that pearl.

author: Regular Person
text:
So ironic how the limitations brought by the hardware of that time is what pushed the creators into developing such masterpieces. Now we have hardware that can run faster and better than anything we could imagine back then, but even the "best" games of today don't have as much impact in us as these can bring even today.

Our games can have a lot more content, but we don't know how to present it properly. We create an open-world rpg that has things to do that would last hundreds of hours of gameplay. But these hours feel nothing more than a chore, most of the time. The crew that creates these projects nowadays can be waaaaay larger than the games from the psx snes era. So our gaming companies have a serious managing problem. Whoever manages to organize this vast number of people into creating content using the best of everyone's creativity, while also taking the least delays and expenditures due to bureaucracy and hierarchical issues, could probably get ahead to the other companies out there.

In fewer words: Gaming companies, give us more story, more interesting relevant characters, but less boring sidequests, please.

author: RF
text: The nostalgia. I still play this song on the piano from time to time. The flow of time never stops, but the memories of better days will remain forever as islands you can step on when the river grows too tall and sinks you in it. This song, I should say this game, is one of those islands for me. This video is a beach from where I can appreciate the flow of the ocean I've left behind and the current that is still dragging me forward. Thank you for uploading this.

author: borot man
text:
Pretending like it's this groundbreaking classic that no game will ever reach will always be a disservice to it when hardcore fans argue that.

It's a simple JRPG from the 90's on the SNES, and all it did for me was hit the right notes in the right time, making it my all-time favourite game.

author: Squall Leonhart
text:
I play it for the first time in summer of 2019 in that time i think the only Final Fantasy games that i don't beat it was 3 and 4 or even 13 i'm not so sure about those 2.

So i was too used to JRPG. This is the most easier RPG that i play and this game doesn't want the frustration of the player, the game want you to see all the endings.



Is a easy game but that doesn't mean that is a bad game. This game has 12 or 13 endings so the game has to be "easy" so you have the motivation to beat it 13 times. Fun fact i beat this game twice and i get the same ending 🤣🤣. I really enjoy this game, the only thing that i don't like is a silence protagonist that is one of the reason that i don't like too much Dragon Quest, Final Fantasy I (all version) and III for famicon is like this game and i don't like that fact but i can enjoyed like i did with Chrono Trigger

author: Lavos
text: Ah, Wind Scene. Or as it's been called in recent times, "Yearnings of the Wind". I personally prefer Wind Scene as a name, because Yearnings of the Wind sounds awfully long and more like a google translated name than an official one. The quality on this song is excellent, I enjoy the added reverb, although the original song never quite spoke to me as it did for some. If you're looking for good remixes of this tune, Malcolm Robinson's "Wind Scene", Blake Robinson's "Yearnings of the Wind", Qumu's "Wind Scene", and Chrono Trigger the Musical's "Yearnings of the Wind" are all incredible.

author: Junbugじゅんばぐ
text:
本当にいい曲。
小６の時に発売日におじぃちゃんに買ってもらってハマった。
放課後はおじぃちゃんの家でクロノトリガー週末泊まってクロノトリガー♪

３６歳になりますがおじいちゃんは８９歳。
長期入院をしていますが毎日仕事前に顔見せています。
時を遡ることが出来ても、未来を変えることができても　このおじぃちゃんに再び会う運命を変えたくありません。

author: Junbugじゅんばぐ
text: @Moco Get  こんばんは。お父様のご冥福をお祈りしますm(_ _)m  この作品に限らずものには色々な想い出が込められていますよね。特にBGMなどがあると本当に目を瞑れば当時に戻ることが出来ますよね😭  子供の感性で感じ取れたあの頃は本当に貴重な時間・時代でしたね。 年配の方が「昔が良かった」というのがピンと来てませんでしたが自分たちが年齢を重ねていくとその言葉の意味が分かってきたような気がします。

author: Moco Get

author: 音渇平性
text:
流れ というものを考える
考える事がもはや流れなのだろう　馬鹿にしてる？子供とは違って餓鬼のたわいもない罵声　もしかして純朴なる悲鳴
その声が「そのとおり」にきこえるという認識を持てたなら、まだ大丈夫。
まあ、その大丈夫は誰空与えられるものでもないし、だから有る無いで優劣などくだされないので、どうぞあの空に向かって。
まだ貴方は優しい顔をしている。
僕は？

author: 文々。あや
text:
憧憬＝憧れなのですね。　この曲を劇中の彼らにも届いているのだとしたら、誰目線の”憧れ”があるか、考えてみました。


中世の人々：平和への憧れ
カエル：勇気、意志、サイラスへの憧れ
サイラス：ゼナンの橋で語った、友に抱く夢と憧れ
封印の宝箱：進化への憧れ♡


　そして、魔王・・・氷泪石を眺める飛影のように、サラのお守りを眺め、まだ正気だった頃の母と姉がいる時代に憧れたのではないでしょうか？


愛猫アルファド（＝星座の中で最も明るい星、の意）のぬくもりを思い出しながら、今日も彼は魔王の仮面を被る・・・
辛い時代ですね。　そんな事を考えさせてくれる本当に素晴らしい音楽です。

author: たーぼう
text:
お兄ちゃんの隣でクロノトリガーを見ていたのが懐かしいです。
いっぱい喧嘩もしたし、
一緒に悪いこともいっぱいした。
でもあの時お兄ちゃんを止めていればお兄ちゃんは今も生きていると思うと胸が苦しいです。これを聞くと涙が止まらない。
自分だけ生きてお兄ちゃんだけ死んだのが悔しい。
もう一度だけ会いたい。
これを聞くと辛いけど、親父の方がもっと辛かったんだなって思うと今は頑張れるよ。
皆も辛いことあるかもしれないけど、
１日１日頑張ろうね。

author: mss spk
text:
主人公が過去の世界に行くと、砂漠の緑化を目指す女性に出会う。
この先ずっと世話のできる人がいないと言われ、仲間のロボがその役を引き受ける。
その後、主人公たちがタイムマシンで未来の同じ場所に行くと、歴史は変わり、砂漠は緑になっていた。
建てられた神殿は最初に出会った女性の名前を冠していて、中には400年も世話を続けて壊れたロボを見つける。

author: REBOLT ThunderV
text:
スーパー原始人ブルー 
最近また日が伸びるとふとした時にこのような感じになりますよ笑

余談ですが
まだ僕が小4のころ
確かその時に当時偶然買ったVジャンプ(だったかな？)にDS版クロノトリガーについて書かれていて
クリスマスにこれが欲しいとずっと口ずさんでいたのです
その時はまだクリスマスプレゼントとというものを完全に信じ込んでいて
親もやっとの思いで見つけたらしいのです。
そして冬休みにガッツリやって
【未来】で詰んで【原始】で詰んでと
とにかく進まず 半ば飽きてしまったりとしていたのです

たった2週間程しかない冬休みでも
今でも本当にいい思い出なんです
数年経った今でもこの曲を聞くと
そんな昔のことを思い出してしまいます笑

何となく辿り着いた。
ただただ懐かしくて
涙が溢れて止まらなかった。
いつも兄がやってるのを
横で見ながら聴いていた。
あの頃の風景が思い出されて
時間が経つ辛さを知りました。
もうお兄ちゃんは居ない。
曲は何も変わらずにあるのに
もうお兄ちゃんは居ない。
26歳は若過ぎ。
今度、仏壇の前で流そうかな。
今日は目が腫れてしまったぜ。

text:
幼馴染の勇者♀と僧侶♂が、世界を滅ぼそうとする魔王を打ち倒す。
そのときに致命傷を負った僧侶が、事切れる寸前に
昔に戻ったような口調で、子供の頃の思い出と、幼くも純粋な愛を交わすような。

クロノトリガーは未プレイですが
そんなシーンを勝手に連想してしまう。

派手さは無いのにこんなにも心を動かす曲も珍しいと感じました。
本当にいい曲です。

あれから何年が経過したんだ？

やっと現世に戻って来れた。

これからは、真っ当に人生と向き合うよ！！
涙が止まらない。

本当にありがとう。

未来が見えなくなる時もあるだろう。

そんな時は後ろを振り返ってみよう。

そこには君を今まで培ってきた…
君を支えてくれた…
君の大切な思い出がある。

未来は決して明るいモノでは
無いかもしれない…
でも、僕たちは知っているはずだ。

未来の自分に伝えてあげなくちゃ。

「こんなにも素晴らしい自分」が
いる事を。

君は1人だ。

1人で歩いて行かなくちゃならない。

でも大丈夫。

「過去」(僕たち)がいるからね。

author: ハゲ頭の上にごはんですよ
text:
@❰❰❰HiroKee❱❱❱  昔のRPGは今のRPGみたいな映画みたいな映像という武器がないから、純粋に内容が濃くて感情移入しやすくて面白いよ。
FFも呼び方でエフエフかファイファンって別れてた時代があって、4～6はしっかりファンタジーしてたからオススメです。
もしFFの全シリーズを今の映像で再現したら、って思いながら4～6をプレイすると7～10超える内容だってわかると思いますよ。

アップありがとうございます(^^)

author: ジジポン
text:
@如月 千早  さっきから一人でお前にコメしてんだけど？
みんなってのは多数の人間に言われてるって事実をわからせたらさすがに気づくと思ったから言ったまでだし、お前が色んな人から言われてるのは事実だろ？
そうやってなんでもかんでも自分の都合良いように勝手に解釈してそれが正しいと思ってるからバカだって言ってんだよ。

普通の人なら多数の人から言われれば少しは気づくんだけどな。

author: 如月 千早
ジジポン
如月 千早
text:
@ジジポン  >何人もの人が親切に言ってくれてるのに
は？
まず、これが大きなお世話(笑)
コメ主以外の人が何言おうがそもそも無意味なの気づけや(笑)俺は聞く気が無いんだよバーカ(笑)はい、残念でした～(笑)来た物には返信はしてやるよ文句付けて(笑)

author: 如月 千早
text:
@ジジポン  お前、じゃあ悪意のあるコメントに全部返信してんのか？
俺が他のコメントいらねぇ、コメ主からコメントだけだって言っているのにそれを逃げるとか(笑)
コメントが見えれば関係あるんか？バカかお前
お前に言ってんじゃなければお前は関係ねぇんだよ
不愉快な気分にお前がなろうが、それはお前が、勝手に自分が言われてる気になっているだけだからだろ(笑)物を分けて考えられないガキ丸出しじゃねぇかよおい(笑)

author: 如月 千早
text:
@ジジポン  は？お前が気違いなんだろ(笑)何々？スルーしようがしまいが勝手？
全然勝手じゃねぇから
俺とコメ主の話に勝手に入って来て何が勝手だよ
結局、暇人がスルー出来ない事を御託を並べてごまかしているだけだろ(笑)

author: ジジポン
text:
@如月 千早  いやいや、スルーをするもしないもお前がそもそも発端となるコメをしたんだろ？

コメ主が反応してなくても何も悪い事してないコメ主に悪意あるコメしといてスルーしろとかお前こそ自分の価値観押し付けんなよ。

言われるような事してる奴がスルーしろとかただ単に逃げてるだけだろ。

何度も言うが、お前とコメ主以外にも内容が見れる時点で無関係にはならないしスルーすればいいってのはお前の都合だからな？

何人もの人が親切に言ってくれてるのにここまで頑なに自分が正しいって主張するのは精神的な病気かもしれないからYouTube見てる時間あるなら病院行きな？

リアルで周囲に迷惑かける前になんとかしたほうがいいよ。

author: 如月 千早
text:
@ジジポン  利害関係だって(笑)お前の価値観を押し付けるなや
俺とコメ主の話なんだよそこにおのような奴がわざわざ暇つぶしで出てくるからこうなってんだろ(笑)

author: ジジポン
ジジポン
text:
@如月 千早  リアルでも悪いことしてたり他人に迷惑かけてる奴は赤の他人から注意を受けたりするだろ？
それと同じ事なんだけどわからないならお前は社会に出てないニートなんじゃない？

関係無いってのは当人同士以外に利害関係が無い場合の話であって
お前のコメを見て不快に思ったりした時点で関係無いだろなんて理屈通るわけないだろって話なんだけどこれも理解できないのか。

お前の中で関係無いと思えば関係無くなるわけじゃないからな？

author: 如月 千早
text:
@ジジポン  関係ないが通じない？
通じるだろ(笑)自分に対して言われているんじゃないんだから黙ってれば？それともニートの暇人だから暇潰しにしゃしゃり出てきてんのかな？(笑)

author: 如月 千早
text:
@ジジポン  ってかお前だれ？いきなり(笑)
謝れ？ならまずお前がしゃしゃり出てきてる事謝れや(笑)関係ないだろそもそもお前

author: ジジポン
text:
@如月 千早  関係無いって思ってるのお前だけだから色んな人から指摘されてんだろ？
グダグダしょーもない言い訳してないで素直に謝ったら？
謝罪もできない程幼稚で愚かなのか？

お前とコメ主以外に見えないやり取りなら関係ないけど、第３者に見える以上関係無いは通用しないから。

author: 頭冷やせよ
text:
これは...
要はキチガイに何言っても話は通じませんってことだな。
当たり前だから見落としがちだけど、耳が聞こえない人に何を喋ったって聞こえない。それと同じことじゃないか。
相手が頭がおかしい人ではないと勝手に思い込んでしまってはいけない。

author: イキリオタク怖
text:
お前は関係ない、お前は関係ないと
関係ない誰かに向けて語る。
関係ない誰かに話しかけられて
その人は無関係と自分で決めた
ただ1人、心に決めた関係者は
触れてもくれず
遂に1人になってしまった関係者...
自分はそれでいい、自分は...と
自分が投げ、自分が受け取る
誰にも関係ないキャッチボールを
自己主張を自分に向けて繰り返す

この虚しさ...哀れなり...

author: 通りすがりに一言言って消えるおじさん
和史今井
text:
なんか荒れてるなって思ってコメント読ん出来たんだけど、11とか言う奴が如月に対して書き込むまで、別に荒れて無いし話はまとまってて、悪い雰囲気では無かったんだよね
それで終わってた所を
この11とか言う奴が余計な書き込みしたから荒れた訳でしょ
つまり今回の原因は11だな
自分で荒れる原因作っておいて、民度が下がるとか言ってるこいつはマジで嫌い
いやいや、民度下げてる原因は貴方だよって感じ

実は天から降り注ぐで1,000以上ダメージで即死。

いかにこの作品は装備をきちっとしないといけないかってね。

勝てないのは腕でもなんでもなくて、クロノを見つけれなかったのが原因なのかもしれないね。（無しでも装備は整えれるけど、装備情報はクロノがいなきゃ教えてくれない）

昨日、このゲームをプレイしている方の生放送を見ていたのですが
マップ移動するときにこの曲が流れていて
このBGMいいなぁ！！と思って今日、他の生放送を見ていると
この曲を歌っている方がいて、この曲は昨日のあの曲だ！！と思い、調べてみると有名な曲だったのですね・・！
改めて、素敵だと思います。幻想的で素晴らしい。
この曲には深い想いが込められていそう。
低音（対旋律）がいい味だしてるなぁ。。
